definition: to lose one's footing/to slip/to take a wrong step in life
a single slip may cause everlasting sorrow (idiom)
pinyin: yi1 shi1 zu2 cheng2 qian1 gu3 hen4

sentences.english: The wolf leaped lamely back, losing its footing and falling in its weakness.
sentences.chinese: 那狼正踉跄着往回跳，因为虚弱一下失足跌倒在地。

sentences.english: In the confusion, Han Weisong slipped and fell down the steps and soon cut off gas.
sentences.chinese: 一片混乱中，韩伟松失足滚下台阶，很快就断了气。

sentences.english: The old lady slipped on the stairs and broke her leg.
sentences.chinese: 这位老太太在楼梯上失足摔断了腿。

sentences.english: It is a good horse that never stumbles .
sentences.chinese: 从来不失足的马才是好马。

sentences.english: An unwary devotee may lose his foothold and fall into a pit of depravity.
sentences.chinese: 易受骗的求道者会失足，掉入堕落的陷阱。

sentences.english: A group society is like a river while deviant youths are oil, being isolated.
sentences.chinese: 失足青年就像浮在水面的油，被社会群体所隔离。

sentences.english: An unlucky fox fell into a well.
sentences.chinese: 一只不走运的狐狸，失足掉到了井里。

sentences.english: We should help the young people who have gone wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我们应当帮助失足的青年。

sentences.english: One day, as they were walking across a stream, Morduch fell down from the bridge and died.
sentences.chinese: 当他们经过一座小桥时，默多克失足落水而死。

sentences.english: Near the edge of the roof, he stumbled on construction materials, lost his footing and fell.
sentences.chinese: 就在房顶边缘处，他绊在施工材料上，失足跌下。

sentences.english: A horse may stumble on four feet.
They may stumble, but they will not fall, for the Lord holds them by the hand.
sentences.chinese: 他纵或失足，也不致颠仆，因为上主扶持著他的手。

sentences.english: The wagon driver watched the waves but suddenly he slipped down into the waterfall.
sentences.chinese: 运货马车夫注视着波浪但突然失足滑进了瀑布。

sentences.english: He that is mighty by a bold tongue is known afar off, but a wise man knoweth to slip by him.
sentences.chinese: 雄辩的人远近皆知，但明智人却知道自己失足的地方。

sentences.english: The best way to help a troubled child is to shower him with love.
sentences.chinese: 帮助失足少年的最好方法是施之以爱。

sentences.english: It's also the reason why many people love eating spicy hot pot, especially in winter.
sentences.chinese: 许多人从此失足，对麻辣火锅吃上了瘾。

definition: a slip/miscalculation/unwise move/accidentally/by mistake/to lose control/to be defeated
to fall into water/to sink/overboard/fig. to degenerate/to sink (into depravity)/to go to the dogs
to fall down/to slip and fall/to throw sb to the ground
to injure oneself in a fall
to fall off or jump off a building
to drown oneself by jumping into the river
to fall into/to dip below a certain level
a single slip may cause everlasting sorrow (idiom)
pinyin: yi1 shi1 zu2 cheng2 qian1 gu3 hen4
